# suspend()

**Instance Method**

Suspends execution of the receiver task.

## Declaration

```swift
func suspend() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver was successfully suspended, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Discussion

Multiple [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/suspend()] messages can be sent, but they must be balanced with an equal number of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/resume()] messages before the task resumes execution.

## Running and Stopping

- **run()**: Runs the process with the current environment.
- **interrupt()**: Sends an interrupt signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
- **resume()**: Resumes execution of a suspended task.
- **terminate()**: Sends a terminate signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
- **waitUntilExit()**: Blocks the process until the receiver is finished.
